snippet: The virus, which is similar to SARS and has killed more than 100 people in the Middle East, was found in a health care worker who recently returned from Saudi Arabia.
abstract: Viral disease known as Middle East respiratory syndrome, or MERS, is found for first time in United States in an Indiana health care worker who traveled to Saudi Arabia; virus has killed more than 100 people in Middle East.
lead_paragraph: The virus, which is similar to SARS and has killed more than 100 people in the Middle East, was found in a health care worker who recently returned from Saudi Arabia.

headline.main: First U.S. Case of MERS Virus Is Found in Indiana Man Who Visited Mideast
headline.print_headline: First U.S. Case of MERS Virus Is Found in Indiana Man Who Visited Mideast

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
